```{r}
Wake_county <-read.csv( "http://tiny.cc/dcf/street-addresses.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
download.file(url="http://tiny.cc/dcf/CMS_ProvidersSimple.rds", destfile = "Adom.rds")
Medicare <- readRDS("Adom.rds")

```

```{r}
pattern <-"ST|RD|ROAD"  #We have set the pattern to Street, RD, and Road
LeftOvers <-            
    Wake_county %>%
  filter(! grepl(pattern, address), !grepl(" BOX ", address))  #We are looking for the opposite the pattern, given the address, we are looking for the opposite of Box, given the address

View(LeftOvers)
```

```{r}
pattern <-"(ST|RD|ROAD|CIRCLE|Way|Trail|CT|DR|Drive|AVE|Terrace|WAY|APT|LN|TRAIL|CIR|LANE|COURT|UNIVERSITY|LANE|RUN|BLVD|SEBTS|CO|PL|NCSU|HALL|NEUSE|HOSPITAL|WOODS|BOX|RD)"  #We have set the pattern to Street, RD, and Road and others, we are trying to set the pattern to capture all possible signs for the road. 
LeftOvers <-            
    Wake_county %>%
  filter(! grepl(pattern, address), !grepl(" BOX ", address)) #This line means that we do not want the street words in the pattern given the addresses, we want LeftOvers without the more common road signs identified in the pattern. The truly unique ones.  
View(LeftOvers)
```

```{r}
DataX <- Wake_county %>%
  tidyr::extract(address, into = "street_word",  # We want to use the tidyr:: extract to get the street word for every address. 
                 regex = pattern, 
                 remove = FALSE) %>%      
                 group_by(street_word) %>%  #We the data by street words
                 summarise(count = n()) %>% #We summarise the data for the count of street words. how many cases per street word. 
                 arrange(desc(count))  # We arranged in descending order, from highest to lowest. 

View(DataX)
```
